definitions.definition: not asleep (especially immediately before or after sleeping)

examples.text: I was still awake when he came to bed.
I was finding it hard to **stay awake**.
He **lies awake** at night worrying about his job.
She was awake *(= not unconscious)* during the operation on her leg.
It was very early and I was only half awake.
Stephen jerked awake from a nightmare.

wordOrigin: Old English āwæcnan, āwacian, both used in the sense ‘come out of sleep’ (from a- ‘to, towards’ and wake).
